intro: Microchaeta strigulosa, commonly known as the hairy microchaeta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its fine, hairy texture on its leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in panicles. Microchaeta strigulosa is an important component of its native ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
